content.title: Intro
content.content:
1912
Preceded by
1912
1913
Year
1914
Followed by
1914

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1913.

content.title: January
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien's twenty-first birthday.
3 - Tolkien contacts Edith Bratt, who subsequently breaks off her engagement with another man.
7 - Actor Francis de Wolff is born.
8 - Engagement of J.R.R. Tolkien and Edith Bratt
21 - Actor Heron Carvic is born.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien begins his diary "JRRT and EMB in account together, AMDG".

content.title: February
content.content: 1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a postcard to Edith Bratt.

content.title: November
content.content: 19 - Exeter College Smoker, featuring a cover illustration by J.R.R. Tolkien, is printed.

content.title: December
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien is elected president of Stapledon Society, a student body at Exeter College.
16 – In an annual Christmas rugby match at King Edward's School, alumni at Oxford and Cambridge play against the School's First XV. This year, the alumni J.R.R. Tolkien, Christopher Wiseman, T.K. Barnsley, Robert Gilson, G.B. Smith and Sidney Barrowclough lose 14-10.
? - First stanza of Valedictory is published in the Stapeldon Magazine.
? - "Oxford Letter", J.R.R. Tolkien's report on former King Edward's pupils at Oxford, is published in King Edward's School Chronicle.

? - Tolkien takes a Second Class in exams and transfers from classics to English, with emphasis in philology, and formally studies Old Norse.
Years
1910 1911 1912 1913 1914 1915 1916
